Multiple inquiries from readers: The expert received numerous inquiries from readers about the alert, indicating that it gained significant attention and raised concerns among the public.
Wide sharing on social media platforms: The claim was widely shared on Facebook and Twitter, suggesting that it reached a large audience and had the potential to influence public perception.
Two forms of the warning: The claim appeared in two different forms - a text post and a photograph of a printed email. This indicates that the message was disseminated through various mediums, potentially increasing its perceived credibility.
Consistency in key components: Both forms of the warning emphasized the importance of keeping the throat moist and avoiding crowded places, indicating a consistent message being conveyed to the public.
